conclusion: The three lower spheres form an equilateral-triangle base.
The upper sphere’s weight is shared equally by the three identical contact points due to symmetry.
Each of the three lower spheres supports one third of the upper sphere’s weight.
The normal force exerted by the upper sphere on any one of the spheres A, B, or C is F = (1/3) mg.
Each of the three lower spheres experiences the same force.
